glsa.title: MPFR: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow vulnerability in MPFR could allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause Denial of Service.

background.p: MPFR is a library for multiple-precision floating-point computations with exact rounding.

description.p: MPFR fails to adequately check user-supplied input, which could lead to a buffer overflow.

impact.p: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All MPFR users should upgrade to the latest version:
